app.revision_history: Fixed bug with windows server launch
app.name: tk_tunnel
app.summary: The Tk_tunnel app can be used to launch a Tcl/Tk 8.5 server outside of Vivado using a standalone Tcl shell, and pass commands from Vivado console to the Tk shell. One of the benefits of this app is to provide a bridge for simple Tk-based GUI.

proc.name: accept_connection
proc.summary: This proc is the callback function when the server receives a connection request Tk / Server command

proc.name: ask
proc.summary: Opens a simple yes/no dialog

proc.name: ask_or_cancel
proc.summary: Opens a simple yes/no/cancel dialog

proc.name: broadcast
proc.summary: This command broadcasts a command / response to all clients from the server Tk / Server command

proc.name: choose_color
proc.summary: Opens a simple 'Choose Color' dialog

proc.name: choose_dir
proc.summary: Opens a simple 'Choose Directory' dialog

proc.name: connect_to_server
proc.summary: This proc is called to connect a client to a server, it will wait until it is connected Tk / Client command

proc.name: exec_push_return
proc.summary: Executes a command locally and broadcasts the return to the client (called by rexec_wait) Tk / Server command

proc.name: failed
proc.summary: Opens a simple retry/cancel dialog

proc.name: hide_server_start
proc.summary: Hides the Tk default window manager (opens via `package require Tk`)

proc.name: launch_server
proc.summary: Starts the server that the Tk commands will be sent to (launched from client) The user can bypass calling this proc and launch the server with a custom command, like: exec xterm -iconic -e /usr/local/tclsh ./custom_start_server.tcl & User / Client command

proc.name: msg
proc.summary: Opens a simple info dialog

proc.name: ok
proc.summary: Opens a simple ok/cancel dialog

proc.name: open_file
proc.summary: Opens a simple 'Open File' dialog

proc.name: rexec
proc.summary: Executes a command on the Tk server (remote exec) User / Client command

proc.name: rexec_wait
proc.summary: Executes a command on the Tk server (remote exec), and waits for the response/return User / Client command

proc.name: save_file
proc.summary: Opens a simple 'Save File' dialog

proc.name: socket_event
proc.summary: This proc is called when a socket event occurs Tk / Client command

proc.name: start_client
proc.summary: Starts the client that will be sending the Tk commands User / Client command

proc.name: start_server
proc.summary: This command launches the listening service on the server User / Server command (normally called from the start_server.tcl script)

proc.name: stdin_event
proc.summary: This proc is called when a stdin event occurs Tk / Server command

proc.name: wait
proc.summary: This proc will wait for a specified time Tk / Client command

proc.name: wait_for_response
proc.summary: Waits for client_return to be set (called by rexec_wait) Tk / Client command
